definition[0]: to be a sign of something that is going to come or happen soon
example[0]: A flash of lightning heralded torrential rain.
example[1]: Flashing blue lights heralded the arrival of the police.
definition[1]: to say publicly that someone or something will be good or important
example[2]: When it opened, the hospital was heralded as a new way forward in nursing care.
definition[2]: someone who carried messages from a ruler in the past
